page.title: 01LOCHALSH VILLAGES
page.content: Three small villages,Reraig,Kirkton and Auchtetyre nestle along the shore of Lochalsh among very fertile, arable land.The hills rising above the villages are heather- clad and partly planted with trees, mainly conifers. From these hills the viewer has a panoramic view of Lochalsh ,Skye and Kintail. {Reraig}is the"business"centre.It has the Stores,Postoffice,filling station, Hotel,holiday chalets,caravan-site and 20 dwellings. {Kirkton}not only has the Parish Church but Tullach Ard Fish Farm,the shinty pitch,15 dwellings and burial grounds. {Auchtertyre}contains the original school of Lochalsh Parish,Auchtertyre Farm and 15 dwellings. Running through and connecting these villages is the Kyle/Inverness road.
